metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6508 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
epan/dissectors/packet-rlc.c in the RLC dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.13 and 2.x before 2.0.5 uses an incorrect integer data type, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (large loop) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1').
